messages.body: $TSLA This is what Elon Musk promised investors how Gigafactory would look like.

$TSLA Bull case for Tesla dying a violent death point by point. Consumers no longer trust or like Tesla brand. https://arstechnica.com/cars/2018/04/months-of-bad-news-has-battered-teslas-image-with-customers-poll-finds/

links.title: Months of bad news has battered Tesla's image with customers, poll finds
links.description: It's no exaggeration to say that Tesla is a remarkable car company. Founded in 2003 by Martin Eberhard and Marc Tarpenning, the company now run by Elon Musk did what many thought impossible-it made the electric vehicle desirable. Don't believe me? Consider the astounding demand for the Model 3.

messages.body:
$TSLA Musk isn't joking about how close he is to facing bankruptcy: 
https://www.zerohedge.com/news/2018-04-28/will-elon-musk-be-next-ceo-face-margin-call-death-spiral

links.title: Will Elon Musk Be the Next CEO to Face A Margin Call Death-Spiral?
links.description: In the annals of CEO margin-call history, among the most infamous are Worldcom's Bernie Ebbers, Chesapeake's Aubrey McLendon and Steinhoff's Christo Wiese. Is Tesla CEO Elon Musk on the path to joining them?
